snippet: Security can be achieved by less-intrusive or sweeping means, without trampling on democratic freedoms and basic rights.
abstract: Editorial contends that the reason most Americans do not seem troubled by revelations about National Security Agency's dragnet collection of phone records is that political leaders are putting forward false choice between security and basic rights; calls on government to give people more information so that public can better judge government's conduct.
lead_paragraph: Security can be achieved by less-intrusive or sweeping means, without trampling on democratic freedoms and basic rights.

headline.print_headline: Violating democratic principles through data collection
